RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowan ces)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OCEAN LILLY rated a slim lead from the three quarter pole, dug in to the challenge of Lace Revolution leaving the three eighths pole and urged clear of that one approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was steadily handled through the lane. GRACE'S SECRET stalked inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, dug in from the head of the lane and was gaining later yards. NAVY SWORD settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and came along to take third mid-stretch. LACE REVOLUTION tapered in through the front stretch and stalked the early pace, challenged the winner leaving the three eighths pole but dropped back approaching the quarter and weakened leaving the far turn. DOOR BUSTER steadied between horses in the vicinity of the three quarter pole and rounded the first turn in the three path, left the turn outside, bid past the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the three path of the far turn. DECISIVE CAUSE showed little response. The Stewards reviewed and dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Lace Revolution for alleged interference in the front stretch, lodged by the rider of Door Buster.

ENTRY.NAME: Grace's Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,gaining late

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean Lilly
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,urged clear near 1/4,rail far turn,steady urging

ENTRY.NAME: Door Buster
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied between early,3p 1st turn,bid 7/16,flattened 3p far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Con sidered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOPPING HENRY pressured the pace and dueled at even terms two deep on the turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew clear through later yards. REMYS GUNSMOKE set a pressured pace, dueled at even term nearest the rail on the turn, was met nearing mid-stretch and relented the final sixteenth. ROYAL PAIN chased the early pace outside, rounded the turn in the four path and ran evenly in the lane. RIVER WARRIOR RVF gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened in the stretch. REATA'S CASTLE gave chase well off the rail through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. JAXJAXXORJACKS chased while saving ground. CHARITABLY GIFTED chased, raced in the three path of the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Charitably Gifted
ENTRY.OWNER: Shepherd Robert Phillips Jason and Harrison Glenn N

ENTRY.NAME: Hopping Henry
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms 2d turn,up near 1/16,clear later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Remys Gunsmoke
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,even terms rail turn,relented 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 34900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since November 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOMEDAY IS TODAY took the lead two deep midway on the opening turn and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. MIDNIGHT BRASS saved ground off the pace, started a bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then dueled through the final sixteenth for second. ELIANAGRACE settled in the three path early, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and was outfinished in a later duel for second. BAYS CASTLE raced well off the pace and off the rail, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and passed some rivals outside. CLASSIC COLORS raced off the earlier pace about the three path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. TIZBIT had a brief early lead inside then stalked from the mid point of the opening turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn then weakened in the lane. CODAS HONOR saved ground well off the pace, raced outside into the backstretch and showed little response. TOUT ENSEMBLE rated off the toward the inside and was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Codas Honor
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Ultra Championship Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Someday Is Today
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured nearing 1/4,rail turn,held well driving

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Schiano Racing Inc. & Carpe Diem Syndicate

ENTRY.NAME: Bays Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,chased 1/2,4p far turn,passed rivals outside

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Colors
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,chased past 1/2,rail far turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 13800. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOOK OF DELANCEY rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested the far turn off the rail, drifted leaving the turn but held well under steady handling. LIL TOUGHMAN rated close inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path, drifted leaving the turn but finished evenly in second. FRONT PORCH settled off the rail, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn, left the turn outside and dueled through the stretch for third. AIR MEDAL saved ground off the pace then eased outward and gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn in the four path then flattened the final sixteenth. RICKYS REVENGE raced five wide on the first turn but saved ground thereafter, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole then flattened near the rail on the far turn. CITIZEN'S FIRE rounded the first turn in the four path and never factored. THATZA ALPHA rounded the first turn in the four path, settled off the pace then faded through the backstretch. SIMILAR TASTE rated close off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but was pulled up approaching the five sixteenth and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Book of Delancey
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,off rail turn,drifted,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Air Medal
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out bid 1/2,4p far turn,flattened 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 96. Starter Allowance Purse 23000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JANUARY 19, 2021. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEVERLY PARK rated close in the four path, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and took over two deep midway on the far turn, ran clear into the lane and widened under steady handling. AARON'S TAP saved early ground then picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn and dug in through the lane to take second the final yards. POSITIVE PHIL raced in the five path the first turn and left the turn outside, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path, dueled through the stretch but relented second in the final yards. SUBJECT TO CHANGE rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened inside the eighth pole. INSIDE RISK rated close in the three path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path then flattened stride. MASAI MAN saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. TRUSTYOURINSTINCT rounded the opening turn in the three path, left the turn outside and showed little response. NO FOOLING DUDE rounded the first turn in the three path and stalked from the nine sixteenths pole, but faded leaving the half mile pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Aaron's Tap
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,5p far turn,dug in lane,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Subject to Change
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 7/16,met rail mid turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 21800. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARK DID IT settled off the rail on the opening turn then eased out with a bid into the backstretch, circled rivals five wide on the far turn then dueled through the stretch to get up the final yards. FREEDOM RIDER saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but raced boxed toward the rail on the far turn, recovered stride to come between horses leaving the eighth pole and took a brief lead mid-stretch, but was caught in the final yards. SPRITZER stalked two deep then challenged nearing the three eighths pole, raced at a close disadvantage off the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. ADDY'S LADDY T N T rounded the first turn in the three and four paths, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced through the far turn about the three path, came between horses leaving the eighth pole but flattened stride with a sixteenth to go. GOT FLOFFY took over at the rail nearing the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, contested the edge at the rail through the far turn but faded in the lane. DOESN'T MAKE CENTS rated close off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. LIKE SEGAL raced in the five path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded in the five path of the far turn. POTENTIAL GRIZZLY rounded the opening turn about the four path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but faded in the four path of the far turn. We B Shackin broke through the gate, ran loose on the track and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom Rider
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,boxed rail far turn,led 1/16,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out,bid 1/2,circled 5wd far turn,up final yards

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Taylor Made Stallions, Inc., George E.Saufley, Pollock Far

ENTRY.NAME: Got Floffy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,edge rail turn,faded lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 1 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHROMATIC LASS rated close inside the first turn then eased out and gave chase into the backstretch, took over two deep approaching the quarter pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and was kept alert to widen down the lane. KARPATHIAN DREAM rounded the opening turn in the four path, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, then dug in from the eighth pole to take second the final strides. CASTLE OF CAYLEE raced well off the pace in the three and four paths the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and finished evenly to take third in the final strides. SARAH'S WARRIOR saved ground, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, but flattened stride the final sixteenth. REVEIRS MINUTE took the lead two deep approaching the nine sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths pole, was met at the rail toward the quarter, continued close through the far turn then flattened in the lane. GLOBAL EMPRESS rated off the pace inside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but faded through the backstretch. NEW AGE BAD GIRL raced off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn. HOW IS SHE was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Chromatic Lass
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,eased out,bid 1/2,up 2d near 1/4,kept alert to widen

ENTRY.NAME: New Age Bad Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Krishack Joanne P and Krishack Stephan E

ENTRY.NAME: Castle of Caylee
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 3& 4p,bid 7/16,4p far turn,even finish,up 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Sarah's Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: Karpathian Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,bid 7/16,3p far turn,dug in lane,up 2nd final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 13800. FOR MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAVANGER rounded the first turn in the six path and raced outside into the backstretch, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, steadily improved and took the lead in the three path at the head of the lane, dueled clear mid-stretch and drew off under vigorous hand urging. GANDHI'S ORION became a little edgy in the gate but took the lead early and rated the pace, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, was met a furlong away and relented the final sixteenth. PAPA CHARLES settled off the rail, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, but flattened stride in the lane. SMOOZER saved ground off the pace, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn at the rail, angled to the five path approaching the top of the stretch, then flattened later yards. PLAYING GOLD rated close inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. BOUBOLINO mostly saved ground. CHERRYS CROSS rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole but faded in the four path of the far turn. HARDIN raced in the five path the first turn, saved ground through the second turn and never factored. DR WILL rated close to the early pace about the three path, but checked leaving the second turn and faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Playing Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Papa Charles
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Hardin
ENTRY.OWNER: Payne Jr Claude G and Tran Alex
